channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: National's $31b transport plan 'pricey but worth it' - Bishop
item.description: National's massive $31 billion plan to improve infrastructure in the upper half of the North Island is expensive but will "move the dial on congestion", says Infrastructure and Transport spokesperson Chris Bishop.

item.title: Numerous roads in Northland closed as region hit by heavy rain, thunderstorms
item.description: State Highway 1 between ÅŒhaeawai and Kawakawa has been closed by heavy flooding, with parts of the Far North getting a month's worth of rain in less than a day.

item.title: Cyclists' gruelling mission to deliver Nikau House petition against proposed closure
item.description: Three people have cycled for two days from Nelson to the steps of Parliament in a bid to save community mental health facility, Nikau House.

item.title: Covid-19 update: One new case in New Zealand in managed isolation
item.description: There has been one new case of Covid-19 reported in managed isolation in New Zealand today, but seven people have recovered.

item.title: Pet food manufacturer fined $130k after worker loses fingertips
item.description: A pet food manufacturer has been fined $130,000 after a worker suffered serious burns and had to have part of their fingers amputated.

item.title: Covid-19: Managed isolation facilities: Queenstown and Invercargill locations ruled out
item.description: The government has ruled out Queenstown and Invercargill as locations for managed isolation facilities.

item.title: Wild weather: '50 percent of Coromandel inaccessible' - Civil defence
item.description: Flooding in the Coromandel Peninsula has eased overnight but several roads remain closed and farms are still under water.

item.title: Chch mayor Lianne Dalziel taking leave of absence due to husband's health
item.description: Christchurch mayor Lianne Dalziel is taking leave of absence from her role due to her husband's health.

item.title: False negatives the big risk for Covid-19 - expert
item.description: New modelling shows the risk of an infectious person slipping through the border undetected remains very low - but only if stringent border controls remain in place.

item.title: Christchurch gas explosion: 'Grossly unjust' for WorkSafe to not follow up sooner, neighbours say
item.description: It took WorkSafe nearly 11 months to make any contact with some Christchurch residents neighbouring a home destroyed in a gas explosion last July.

item.title: Man sought in relation to card-skimming in Auckland, Waikato
item.description: Police are investigating reports of card-skimming involving parking machines at Auckland and Waikato hospitals.

item.title: 'We had to slash our spending': Auckland Council cuts jobs, defers projects
item.description: Aucklanders will have to pay more in rates, but will get less, as the council tries to fill a $750 million hole in its budget.

item.title: Northland park gets $6m for upgrade
item.description: A Northland sports park will get millions from the government's infrastructure package to upgrade its facilities.

item.title: Abuse survivors angry at lack of change in Defence Force's 'code of silence' culture
item.description: Abuse survivors are angry - but not surprised - that problems persist in the Defence Force's culture, even after four years of Operation Respect.

item.title: People urged to stay off roads as Coromandel 'battered'
item.description: Three sections of State Highway 25 will stay shut overnight, as the eastern Coromandel Peninsula is doused by heavy rain.

item.title: Team NZ questioned over $1.5m wage subsidies
item.description: Employees at Team New Zealand have been paid nearly $1.5 million in government wage subsides, but questions are being raised over what revenue the syndicate lost from the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Maternity services get extra $180 million, midwives in line for pay rises
item.description: Rural midwives are in line for as much as a 40 percent pay rise, with the government finally bringing more funding for the sector, and hope the boost will entice more into the job.

item.title: Body found in search for Dunedin fisherman missing since last week
item.description: A body has been found in the search for a Dunedin man who went missing in Lake Wakatipu last week.
